events.title: We Are Evolution with Samantha Beers
events.description: We Are Evolution:  How does evolution function as the sure intelligence of life?  How are you, as a human being, a key part of shaping the future?  Why are people (and our unique, yet not special, souls) particularly important to the patterns of biological and consciousness evolution in our Galaxy at this time?  Join High Priestess and Regenerative Design Expert, Samantha Sweetwater for this interactive playshop where you will learn how to surf the integral & biological mechanisms of evolution.  Find and amplify your unique place and point of leverage in the soul ecology of Life.  Uplevel your present sense of purpose.  And, together with all others present, discover how to co-cause the future we want.
events.print_description: We Are Evolution:  Surf the integral & biological mechanisms of evolution. Uplevel your present life.  Discover how to co-cause the future we WANT.

events.title: We are Not Your Freak Show
events.description: Have you ever noticed that BM is not really a safe space for everyone? Have you ever felt like you are being treated like a freak because of your gender identity? Are you over people asking why your body looks the way it does? Are you interested in creating real safe spaces for people whether they fit in the binary or not? Are you troubled by cultural appropriation on playa and the way some folks are treated as other or freaks in a way that doesn't feel good? Then this workshop is for you. This workshop is also for you if you want to delve into the intersections of race, gender, class and how these identities affect our experience at BM and beyond. Many of us come to playa to be free and our full liberated selves yet when we pass through the gate we have not dropped our baggage of racism, transphobia, sexism, abelism, and classism at the gate.  So let's be real and talk about how these isms affect our time on playa and off and what we want to do to create the world we want to live in. This workshop will be interactive, engaging, fun, and educational. Let's define what we want the word freakshow to me and let's reclaim ourselves and whole people who all deserve respect.
events.print_description: Are you curious how to create a safe and inclusive space for people of all backgrounds? Come, learn, explore, and share

events.title: Wear Only A Smile Yoga

events.print_description: Our bodies are sacred, our natural state is naked. Experience the sensations of your uncovered body moving through yoga poses without shame.

events.title: Weather Reporter vs. The Author
events.description:
To put it very simply; when someone is being a Weather Reporter, it is as if they have no control over the circumstances that exist, it just is the way it is because of influences out of their control. Being an Author is looking at things as the creator and being responsible for outcomes. 

This is especially valuable in a group like this where people are counted on to produce serious results, as the conversation is about clearing away self-limiting thoughts and replacing them with positive and proactive ones. However, this isn’t a one-time cheerleading session, but rather an introduction to a simple yet revolutionary way of thinking about things that people can take with them. Each person will begin to redefine a new and powerful context from which 
to run their professional and personal life.
events.print_description: Learn to be the master of your circumstances.

events.description:

Every Burner that will come to the workshop will have a chance to weave a bracelet for himself/herself and to carry it on its wrist not only in the Playa but also back home.
events.print_description: Need some challenges? Come and weave a bracelet for yourself in Lithuanian traditional style.

events.title: What are those 5Rhythms anyway? w/Marcia
events.description: Just like light, sound, or ocean waves, a dancing body moving freely passes through five distinct rhythmic patterns. These patterns continuously repeat themselves in a wave of motion. The 5Rhythms are: FLOWING – the fluid, continuous, grounded glide of our own movements; STACCATO – the percussive, pulsing beat that shapes us a thousand different ways; CHAOS – the rhythm of letting go, releasing into the catalytic wildness of our dance that can never be planned or repeated; LYRICAL – the rhythm of trance, where the weight of self-consciousness dissolves, where we lighten up and disappear into our own uniqueness; and STILLNESS – the quiet emptiness, where gentle movements rise and fall, start and end, in a field of silence. Please join Marcia Dancing Heart for an introduction to the 5Rhythms at RhythmWave.
events.print_description: A dancing body moving freely passes through five distinct rhythmic patterns. Please join Marcia Dancing Heart for an introduction to the 5Rhythms.

events.title: Why Festivals are Important for Humanity
events.description: Festivals have been with us since man and woman started to gather, but there's been a big uptick in global festival attendance in the 21st century. events.title: Working with Spirit Guides
events.description:
We are all connected to the same Source of all life, but as individuals, the experience of contact with inner guidance and spiritual beings will be different for everyone. Whether we consider these forms of intelligence to be higher aspects of our own selves or independent entities, the challenge is the same: how do we access and validate this wisdom? Our spiritual guides communicate with us through intuition, and we only need to refine our ability to receive. Craig will teach his unique methods, which include powerful ways of opening up one’s awareness to the realm of divine guidance. You will learn to trust the, information you receive, to control and direct your psychic energy and to explore new ways of creative problem solving.

Your new life and your letter will arrive back to you in 1 or 3 years.  It's AMAZING!  Guaranteed results or your money back!.

We'll have meditation, creative visualization exercises plus paper, coloring books, stickers, stamps, and the key to your future.

events.title: Zendo Project
events.description:
The Zendo is a community outreach project at Burning Man that offers education and psychological support, with the goal to help reduce the potential harms involved in drug use. Volunteers provide peer-to-peer harm reduction support for individuals having a difficult drug-related experience and who don't require medical care. Guests are sometimes actively on substance, and other times are seeking integration support, or education about the risks involved in drug use. We staff the space 24/7 with trained mental health and medical professionals who provide oversight, as well as individuals experienced in crisis response.

If you'd like to come to the training to learn more about volunteering, it will take place at Something Freaky This Way Foams, near 2:00&G, on Tuesday September 1 at 11AM. 

The four principles of psychedelic harm reduction include: 

1. Create a safe space - If someone is having a challenging experience try to move them into a comfortable, warm, and calm environment. If possible, try to avoid noisy or crowded spaces. Ask what would make them most comfortable. Offer blankets and water. 

2. Sitting, not guiding - Be a calm presence of acceptance, compassion, and caring. Promote feelings of trust and security. Let the person's unfolding experience be the guide. Don't try to get ahead of their process. Explore distressing issues if they want, but know that simply being with the person is supportive and talking may not be helpful.

3. Talk through, not down - Invite the person to explore what's happening and encourage them to try not to resist it. Remind them that they are safe. 

4. Difficult is not the same as bad - challenging experiences can wind up being our most valuable and lead to learning and growth. Help the person integrate the experience, and remind them the experience will continue to unfold.
events.print_description: Feeling out of sorts? Visit Zendo where you'll find a calm space and volunteers who are available 24/7 to help with difficult psychedelic experiences.

events.title: Zen Garden
events.description: The Zen Garden is a 24/7 peaceful, shaded space for anyone needing to chill out, cool down, and ground. There will be Zen Geishas (look for kimonos) monitoring the tent throughout the days and nights in case you need someone to check in with - or just hug. We will also post daily schedules of meditation, yoga, tea service, or other nice things, so come by!

events.title: Ayla Nereo sunrise set ~ Abraxas @ THE BALL
events.description:
FRI morning at 7 AM ~ Ayla will sing in the heart to greet the dawning sun, on the back of the dragon. (At The BALL in deep playa.)   

With an array of loop-pedals by her side, she builds layer upon layer of vocal melodies into fierce, sweeping harmonies and weaves syncopated threads of guitar, kalimba, piano, and percussion into each live performance.  

Her lucid storytelling and lyrical imagery are water for the thirsty soul; words and sounds that crack open the heart, and embody the many folds of our own selves. 
Crafting an immersive soundscape we can dive into, Ayla’s performance becomes a journey: an inspired, wondrous experience that holds you by the heart and doesn’t let go. 
   
|| www.aylanereo.com || www.facebook.com/ayla.nereo.music || wwwsoundcloud.com/ayla-nereo

events.title: Biodanza:  From Instinct to Inspiration
events.description:
Biodanza has been baring hearts since the 60's. Developed in S. America it is now a world wide phenomenon bringing joy, pleasure, balance, health and healing through music, dance and sincere interaction. Contact and caress are tools of our trade. We deal in deep human intimacy, through touch, eye contact, movement and body language. Not verbal communication. We feel each other, letting the mind and its ways take a back seat for a change. We enhance our senses, our instincts and our state of consciousness. We perceive and experience ourselves and others differently when we do this. More authentically. More naked. 
The first hour is for interactive activation and expression, maybe getting a little wild together. The second half is for slowing down, relaxing, melting and harmoniously merging with one another, exercising the polarities of enhanced sense of self to oceanic experience.
events.print_description: Interactive dance-movement-contact workshop to stimulate residual potentials in vitality-creativity-sexuality-universal love.  With Niraj

events.title: Body Gallery
events.description: Begin with grounding and group exercises. Talk about body image and shaming. How do we experience this in the default world. How or is this different at burning man. Explaining that even compliments in this workshop must be consensual. Leading into 3-6 pods (based on numbers). Within the pods we take turns undressing each person.  This is like the Museum of Burningman Bodies. Within each pod we each have 2-3 minutes to tell our museum visitors about our body. Depending on group vibe and any time left, viewers may ask questions of the exhibit, or  request something they would like to be uplifted upon. The next person presents. This workshop will be tested this coming week at a regional burn. I‚Äôve started something without structure before at a workshop intensive of 18 people. Great experience. **90-120 min window ** will test out this weekend
events.print_description: Bare your body in a safe pace as we navigate feelings around body image and body shaming. Participation: comfort around nudity.

This is like the Museum of Burningman Bodies. Within each pod we each have 2-3 minutes to tell our museum visitors about our body. Depending on group vibe and any time left, viewers may ask questions of the exhibit, or  request something they would like to be uplifted upon. The next person presents. This workshop will be tested this coming week at a regional burn. I‚Äôve started something without structure before at a workshop intensive of 18 people. Great experience. **90-120 min window ** will test out this weekend
events.print_description: Bare your body in a safe pace as we navigate feelings around body image and body shaming. Participation: comfort around nudity.

events.title: Circuscape
events.description: Circuscape is an interactive circus of the senses. Come lose yourself in one or all of our activities. In Mindscape, you'll participate in sensory illusions that will make you doubt what is real. In Moonscape, you'll be transported onto an alien world as you traverse our low-gravity obstacle course. In Spiritscape, you'll take inventory of your soul's baggage lighten your emotional load.
events.print_description: Circuscape is an interactive circus of the senses. Come lose yourself in our mind bending, body stretching, emotion unburdening activities!

events.title: Cocoona Matata: Guided movement ritual
events.description: The Cocoon is sheer, stretchy enclosure made of colorful spandex and a zipper. From the outside, the Cocoon embodies architecture as a live, morphing sculpture, based on the forces of the body. From the inside, the Cocoon is a blank slate, out of which you have the freedom to create and stylize your experience. In order to go through great transformations, we must let our out-of-date stories die so a new paradigm can be born. In this workshop we will re-enact that experience of death and re-birth, emerging through a "birth canal" with the support and assistance of the group to guide us towards a transformed self.
events.print_description: Re-wire for more positivity! Using props to fortify the body-mind-spirit flow, shed your old skin and see a worry-free butterfly emerge

events.title: Creative Visualization: Picture your future
events.description: Join us for a guided creative visualization meditation. We will help you picture the perfect day 10 yrs in your future. The process works by subconsciously shifting your decision making over the next 10 years eventually making your vision a reality. You don't know what that day looks like? Don't worry, most people don't, but your subconscious already knows what is important to it. The more amazing and compelling the vision that you let emerge, the more you will be drawn to it. How? Most people make between 80 to 400 decisions a day. A rich, compelling visualization with a lot of sensory "hooks" can shift those decisions towards your perfect future because the right choices will feel "right". We will start with a mindfulness of breath meditation, a gratitude exercise and then wake up the morning of your perfect day and explore it through a guided process. After, we will ask a few of those interested to share their visualization with the group. We look forward to sharing your future day together. Dr.Feelgood
events.print_description: Join us for a guided creative visualization meditation. We will help you picture the perfect day 10 yrs in your future.

events.description: Ecstatic Shaking is an ancient tantric tools used to raise our life force energy from earth to heaven. Our frustrations, resistances and blockages become rocket fuel for our transformation and awakening! This technique, based on teachings from a guru in Bali, raises the kundalini energy, raises our vibration, raises our consciousness. It is the place that orgasm becomes prayer and we can expand to touch the universe.
events.print_description: Discover the way to reach an orgasm with the Divine! Using our life challenges as rocket fuel, let your energy reach the heavens!

Bring friends to join you in this bonding experience, or just come on your own!

events.title: Lust & Marriage: A Woman's Journey into Polyamory
events.description: From the opening moments, we learn this solo show is about soul mates, and the search for love and lust. Emily is the hero of the story, a character very much a literary stand-in for author and performer Eleanor O’Brien. We meet her as a child, fascinated by romance novels and her father’s porn. The show traces her journey from awkward teen to college boyfriends, complete with disappointing first times and disastrous blowjobs. But then she discovers renown sex-columnist Dan Savage, her ‘gay fairy godfather’. Dan helps her learn to ask for what she wants (“I can touch my own clit during sex?”), and encourages her to be GGG (Good, Giving and Game). Emily goes on a spree of experimentation, culminating in the “grand prix of getting lucky,” Burning Man. At the world’s largest alternative event, she meets Matt, who turns out to be the love of her life-but he doesn’t identify as monogamous. Can they make it work? Emily asks Dan for advice as they navigate the thrills and valleys of opening the relationship: how to negotiate boundaries, deal with jealousy and keep from falling in love with other people. She thinks if they follow the rules they've set, they can keep their relationship safe. They can be “monogamish,” and keep the spark in their marriage. When a magical threesome drives her to utter meltdown, Emily insists on closing their marriage. But monogamy doesn’t solve all their problems. Emily and Matt discover they have different libidos - and the seven-year itch isn’t a myth. He encourages her to spread her wings, so she takes a lover. All's fine for a while, but soon she finds herself falling in love with Michael, her NSA partner for play. She is terrified of losing her marriage to Matt, and asks Dan again for advice. “Is polyamory a utopian ideal?” During an ayahuasca ceremony, Emily finally sees where she's been blind to how her behavior has stifled her marriage, and how she has to let go of the need for certainty, or controlling anyone else’s heart.
events.print_description: This one woman play by Eleanor O'Brien of Dance Naked Prod. received critical acclaim at this year's Canadian Fringe Festival. 75 minute running time

events.title: Alternatives to Marriage
events.description: Traditionally the way to commit has been Marriage, with over 50% of marriages ending in divorce, many are looking for a different solution.  Many see value in a commitment of some sort but what are the options? What is working for people and what is not.  Come explore alternatives to marriage in a very interactive discussion/workshop.  There are other ways to commit, come explore those with us in a fun way.

events.title: Energetic Hygiene - Managing Your Energy Field
events.description: As humans, we have our physical bodies and our energetic bodies. It’s pretty easy to know when you are holding hands with another person - but what about when you are energetically entangled? Burning man is the perfect place to explore Energetic Hygiene. In this interactive workshop we will play with different techniques for becoming aware of your field, clearing it, and expanding & containing it. Becoming aware of your energetic field and knowing how to use it is one of the most empowering things you can do for yourself - and it’s fun!

events.title: Nightly "Celluloid" Debauchery - Back Alley Cinema
events.description:
The Back Alley Cinema (located appropriately enough behind the Black Rock City Self Service Abortion Clinic) has been providing literally dozens of burners with nightly entertainment, intermittently, since 2009.  Now a part of the Cult of the Magic Lady!

Come plop yourself down on a couch... or on a fellow burner... or on a fellow burner ON a couch..  Enjoy fresh popped corn in the middle of nowhere.  Programming varies but, with a library of terabytes of entertainment onhand, is bound to be... entertaining to someone.  Bring a friend!  Or two!  Maybe even three, but let's not overdo it, we usually don't have THAT much room.

Everyone has to grow tired of nonstop raving now and again (I think... Do you?  Honestly, I wouldn't know... Never really was my thing...  Which is why I run a theater... in a desert..  Oh crap, I think I may have gotten off track...) so take a night off and JOIN US...

Free intoxicants for the kids!  (No, not really... I'm actually just amazed at how many characters I'm allowed to type in this section...  Really.  I've only just passed the halfway point.  Isn't that nuts?  How are you to be expected to come up with so much to say, really...?)

Previous nights have included: Dude Night (Tron, The Fisher King, The Big Lebowski), Musical Night (Repo: The Musical, Tommy, Suck)... Some nights we don't even HAVE themes!  (Because, you know... Burning Man...  Plans vaporize!)

So be sure to visit us at some point in your travels.  You can also get yourself loaded at the Koi Lounge, and of course HAVE AN ABORTION... Or two... Or three! (You slut, but we don't do shame because.... What's the point?)
events.print_description:
"Live people ignore the strange and unusual..."  Why be like them?
Nightly double/triple features of cult/oddities/what-have-you... MOVIES! POPCORN!
